quiz.text: The cost price of mobile is 20% less than the cost price of laptop after allowing two successive discounts 25% and 20% respectively. If the cost price of a watch is 30%less than that of the cost price of laptop after allowing two successive discounts of 20% and 20% respectively, then the cost price of mobile is approximately what percent more than that of the cost price of watch?

7%
5%
1%
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of the money becomes Rs.5580 after 2 years when invested in scheme A which offers simple interest and the same sum of money becomes Rs.6120 after 3 years when invested in scheme B which offers the same simple interest as scheme A. What is the interest earned a person if he invested the same money in scheme C which offers compound interest for 2 years at the rate of 10% per annum?
options: Rs.945
Rs.1080
Rs.1145
Rs.1275
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of the monthly income of A to B is 4:3 and the ratio of the monthly income of B to C is 2:1. If the difference between the C’s monthly income and his savings is Rs.12000 and the saving’s of C is half of his expenditure, then what is the average of the income of A, B and C?
options: Rs.27000
Rs.31000
Rs.34000
Rs.29000
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of A’s age, 8 years after to present age of B is 3: 5 and B’s present age is 25% of C’s age after 15 years. After 4 years A’ age is 12.5% of D’s age after 4 years. If the sum of the ages of A, B, C and D after 1 year is 101, then what is the present age of B?
options: 18 years
15 years
12 years
14 years
None of these

quiz.text: Rahul spends 25% of his salary on education fees and 20% of the salary on House rent. From the remaining amount he spends on shopping to transport in the ratio of 4: 3 and the amount on  transport is Rs.1100 What is the approximate salary of Rahul?

quiz.text: A and B started the business with the investment of Rs.4000 and Rs.6000 respectively and the investment period of A and B is 6 months and 8 months respectively. If B received the total profit Rs.2800, then find the total profit.

Rs.4700

quiz.text: A bike travels a distance of 360 km with certain speed. If the bike travels 25% of the distance at speed of 60% of the usual speed, 80% of the remaining distance at the speed of 80% of the usual speed and the remaining distance at 90% of the usual speed. If the total time taken by the bike is 8 hours, then find the usual speed of the bike?
options: 40 kmph
50 kmph
60 kmph
80 kmph
None of these

quiz.text: If efficiency of Pipe A is six-fifth of pipe B and the efficiency of pipe B is five - fourth of pipe C, then pipe C alone fill half of the tank in _____ hours. Pipe A, B and C together fill the tank in 8 hours.

24 hours
20 hours
25 hours
None of these

quiz.text: Find the respective ratio of efficiencies of pipe p and pipe q? Statement I: pipe ‘p’ and pipe ’ r’ together can fill the tank in 96 minutes. With pipe ‘q’ they can fill the tank in 160/3 minutes Statement II: pipe ‘q’ and pipe ‘r’ with double of their efficiency can fill the tank in 240/7 minutes Statement III: pipe ‘q’ and pipe ‘p’ together can fill the tank in 80 minutes, the ratio of the efficiency of pipe ‘p’ and pipe ‘r’ = 4:7 Statement IV: pipe ‘q’ and pipe ‘r’ can fill the tank in 65 minutes, the ratio of efficiency of pipe ‘q’ and ‘r’ =3:5
options: if only 1 statement is sufficient to answer the question
if 2 statements are sufficient to answer the question
if 3 statements are sufficient to answer the question
if all the statements are required to answer the question
if none of the statements are sufficient to answer the question

if 3 statements are sufficient to answer the question
if all the statements are required to answer the question
if none of the statements are sufficient to answer the question

if none of the statements are sufficient to answer the question

quiz.text: Which of the following options is correct?
options: A quadratic equation always has two roots.
If the discriminant of a quadratic equation is negative, then it has no roots.
If the coefficient of the square term in a quadratic equation is negative, then it has no real roots.
If the discriminant is 0, then the quadratic equation has exactly one root.
